Name: Account
Docs:
Account exports web API functions for the account web interface. All its
methods are exported under api/. Function calls require valid HTTP
Authentication credentials of a user.

Functions.Name: LoginPrep
Functions.Docs:
LoginPrep returns a login token, and also sets it as cookie. Both must be
present in the call to Login.

Functions.Name: Login
Functions.Docs:
Login returns a session token for the credentials, or fails with error code
"user:badLogin". Call LoginPrep to get a loginToken.

Functions.Name: Logout
Functions.Docs: Logout invalidates the session token.

Functions.Name: SetPassword
Functions.Docs:
SetPassword saves a new password for the account, invalidating the previous password.
Sessions are not interrupted, and will keep working. New login attempts must use the new password.
Password must be at least 8 characters.

Functions.Name: Account
Functions.Docs:
Account returns information about the account.
StorageUsed is the sum of the sizes of all messages, in bytes.
StorageLimit is the maximum storage that can be used, or 0 if there is no limit.

Functions.Name: AccountSaveFullName
Functions.Docs:
AccountSaveFullName saves the full name (used as display name in email messages)
for the account.

Functions.Name: DestinationSave
Functions.Docs:
DestinationSave updates a destination.
OldDest is compared against the current destination. If it does not match, an
error is returned. Otherwise newDest is saved and the configuration reloaded.

Functions.Name: ImportAbort
Functions.Docs:
ImportAbort aborts an import that is in progress. If the import exists and isn't
finished, no changes will have been made by the import.

Functions.Name: Types
Functions.Docs: Types exposes types not used in API method signatures, such as the import form upload.

Functions.Name: SuppressionList
Functions.Docs: SuppressionList lists the addresses on the suppression list of this account.

Functions.Name: SuppressionAdd
Functions.Docs: SuppressionAdd adds an email address to the suppression list.

Functions.Name: SuppressionRemove
Functions.Docs: SuppressionRemove removes the email address from the suppression list.

Functions.Name: OutgoingWebhookSave
Functions.Docs:
OutgoingWebhookSave saves a new webhook url for outgoing deliveries. If url
is empty, the webhook is disabled. If authorization is non-empty it is used for
the Authorization header in HTTP requests. Events specifies the outgoing events
to be delivered, or all if empty/nil.

Functions.Name: OutgoingWebhookTest
Functions.Docs:
OutgoingWebhookTest makes a test webhook call to urlStr, with optional
authorization. If the HTTP request is made this call will succeed also for
non-2xx HTTP status codes.

Functions.Name: IncomingWebhookSave
Functions.Docs:
IncomingWebhookSave saves a new webhook url for incoming deliveries. If url is
empty, the webhook is disabled. If authorization is not empty, it is used in
the Authorization header in requests.

Functions.Name: IncomingWebhookTest
Functions.Docs:
IncomingWebhookTest makes a test webhook HTTP delivery request to urlStr,
with optional authorization header. If the HTTP call is made, this function
returns non-error regardless of HTTP status code.

Functions.Name: FromIDLoginAddressesSave
Functions.Docs:
FromIDLoginAddressesSave saves new login addresses to enable unique SMTP
MAIL FROM addresses ("fromid") for deliveries from the queue.

Functions.Name: KeepRetiredPeriodsSave
Functions.Docs: KeepRetiredPeriodsSave saves periods to save retired messages and webhooks.

Functions.Name: AutomaticJunkFlagsSave
Functions.Docs:
AutomaticJunkFlagsSave saves settings for automatically marking messages as
junk/nonjunk when moved to mailboxes matching certain regular expressions.

Functions.Name: RejectsSave
Functions.Docs: RejectsSave saves the RejectsMailbox and KeepRejects settings.

Fields.Name: JunkFilter
Fields.Docs: todo: sane defaults for junkfilter

Fields.Name: DNSDomain
Fields.Docs: Parsed form of Domain.

Fields.Name: IsForward
Fields.Docs: todo: once we implement ARC, we can use dkim domains that we cannot verify but that the arc-verified forwarding mail server was able to verify.

Structs.Name: Domain
Structs.Docs:
Domain is a domain name, with one or more labels, with at least an ASCII
representation, and for IDNA non-ASCII domains a unicode representation.
The ASCII string must be used for DNS lookups. The strings do not have a
trailing dot. When using with StrictResolver, add the trailing dot.

Fields.Name: ASCII
Fields.Docs: A non-unicode domain, e.g. with A-labels (xn--...) or NR-LDH (non-reserved letters/digits/hyphens) labels. Always in lower case. No trailing dot.

Fields.Name: Unicode
Fields.Docs: Name as U-labels, in Unicode NFC. Empty if this is an ASCII-only domain. No trailing dot.

Fields.Name: Period
Fields.Docs: todo: have a reasonable default for this?

Structs.Name: Suppression
Structs.Docs:
Suppression is an address to which messages will not be delivered. Attempts to
deliver or queue will result in an immediate permanent failure to deliver.

Fields.Name: Account
Fields.Docs: Suppression applies to this account only.

Fields.Name: BaseAddress
Fields.Docs: Unicode. Address with fictional simplified localpart: lowercase, dots removed (gmail), first token before any "-" or "+" (typical catchall separator).

Fields.Name: OriginalAddress
Fields.Docs: Unicode. Address that caused this suppression.

Structs.Name: ImportProgress
Structs.Docs: ImportProgress is returned after uploading a file to import.

Fields.Name: Token
Fields.Docs: For fetching progress, or cancelling an import.

Structs.Name: Outgoing
Structs.Docs: Outgoing is the payload sent to webhook URLs for events about outgoing deliveries.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: Format of hook, currently 0.

Fields.Name: Event
Fields.Docs: Type of outgoing delivery event.

Fields.Name: DSN
Fields.Docs: If this event was triggered by a delivery status notification message (DSN).

Fields.Name: Suppressing
Fields.Docs: If true, this failure caused the address to be added to the suppression list.

Fields.Name: QueueMsgID
Fields.Docs: ID of message in queue.

Fields.Name: FromID
Fields.Docs: As used in MAIL FROM, can be empty, for incoming messages.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: From Message-Id header, as set by submitter or us, with enclosing <>.

Fields.Name: Subject
Fields.Docs: Of original message.

Fields.Name: WebhookQueued
Fields.Docs: When webhook was first queued for delivery.

Fields.Name: SMTPCode
Fields.Docs: Optional, for errors only, e.g. 451, 550. See package smtp for definitions.

Fields.Name: SMTPEnhancedCode
Fields.Docs: Optional, for errors only, e.g. 5.1.1.

Fields.Name: Error
Fields.Docs: Error message while delivering, or from DSN from remote, if any.

Fields.Name: Extra
Fields.Docs: Extra fields set for message during submit, through webapi call or through X-Mox-Extra-* headers during SMTP submission.

Structs.Name: Incoming
Structs.Docs: Incoming is the data sent to a webhook for incoming deliveries over SMTP.

Fields.Name: Version
Fields.Docs: Format of hook, currently 0.

Fields.Name: From
Fields.Docs: Message "From" header, typically has one address.

Fields.Name: BCC
Fields.Docs: Often empty, even if you were a BCC recipient.

Fields.Name: ReplyTo
Fields.Docs: Optional Reply-To header, typically absent or with one address.

Fields.Name: MessageID
Fields.Docs: Of Message-Id header, typically of the form "<random@hostname>", includes <>.

Fields.Name: InReplyTo
Fields.Docs: Optional, the message-id this message is a reply to. Includes <>.

Fields.Name: References
Fields.Docs: Optional, zero or more message-ids this message is a reply/forward/related to. The last entry is the most recent/immediate message this is a reply to. Earlier entries are the parents in a thread. Values include <>.

Fields.Name: Date
Fields.Docs: Time in "Date" message header, can be different from time received.

Fields.Name: Text
Fields.Docs: Contents of text/plain and/or text/html part (if any), with "\n" line-endings, converted from "\r\n". Values are truncated to 1MB (1024*1024 bytes). Use webapi MessagePartGet to retrieve the full part data.

Fields.Name: Structure
Fields.Docs: Parsed form of MIME message.

Fields.Name: Meta
Fields.Docs: Details about message in storage, and SMTP transaction details.

Fields.Name: Name
Fields.Docs: Optional, human-readable "display name" of the addressee.

Fields.Name: Address
Fields.Docs: Required, email address.

Fields.Name: ContentType
Fields.Docs: Lower case, e.g. text/plain.

Fields.Name: ContentTypeParams
Fields.Docs: Lower case keys, original case values, e.g. {"charset": "UTF-8"}.

Fields.Name: ContentID
Fields.Docs: Can be empty. Otherwise, should be a value wrapped in <>'s. For use in HTML, referenced as URI `cid:...`.

Fields.Name: DecodedSize
Fields.Docs: Size of content after decoding content-transfer-encoding. For text and HTML parts, this can be larger than the data returned since this size includes \r\n line endings.

Fields.Name: Parts
Fields.Docs: Subparts of a multipart message, possibly recursive.

Fields.Name: MsgID
Fields.Docs: ID of message in storage, and to use in webapi calls like MessageGet.

Fields.Name: MailFrom
Fields.Docs: Address used during SMTP "MAIL FROM" command.

Fields.Name: MailFromValidated
Fields.Docs: Whether SMTP MAIL FROM address was SPF-validated.

Fields.Name: MsgFromValidated
Fields.Docs: Whether address in message "From"-header was DMARC(-like) validated.

Fields.Name: RcptTo
Fields.Docs: SMTP RCPT TO address used in SMTP.

Fields.Name: DKIMVerifiedDomains
Fields.Docs: Verified domains from DKIM-signature in message. Can be different domain than used in addresses.

Fields.Name: RemoteIP
Fields.Docs: Where the message was delivered from.

Fields.Name: Received
Fields.Docs: When message was received, may be different from the Date header.

Fields.Name: MailboxName
Fields.Docs: Mailbox where message was delivered to, based on configured rules. Defaults to "Inbox".

Fields.Name: Automated
Fields.Docs: Whether this message was automated and should not receive automated replies. E.g. out of office or mailing list messages.

Strings.Name: OutgoingEvent
Strings.Docs:
OutgoingEvent is an activity for an outgoing delivery. Either generated by the
queue, or through an incoming DSN (delivery status notification) message.

Values.Name: EventDelivered
Values.Docs:
Message was accepted by a next-hop server. This does not necessarily mean the
message has been delivered in the mailbox of the user.

Values.Name: EventSuppressed
Values.Docs:
Outbound delivery was suppressed because the recipient address is on the
suppression list of the account, or a simplified/base variant of the address is.

Values.Name: EventDelayed
Values.Docs: A delivery attempt failed but delivery will be retried again later.

Values.Name: EventFailed
Values.Docs:
Delivery of the message failed and will not be tried again. Also see the
"Suppressing" field of [Outgoing].

Values.Name: EventRelayed
Values.Docs:
Message was relayed into a system that does not generate DSNs. Should only
happen when explicitly requested.

Values.Name: EventExpanded
Values.Docs:
Message was accepted and is being delivered to multiple recipients (e.g. the
address was an alias/list), which may generate more DSNs.

Values.Name: EventCanceled
Values.Docs: Message was removed from the queue, e.g. canceled by admin/user.

Values.Name: EventUnrecognized
Values.Docs:
An incoming message was received that was either a DSN with an unknown event
type ("action"), or an incoming non-DSN-message was received for the unique
per-outgoing-message address used for sending.
